TopicTitle: query - use new ModuleResourceConverter or TACGenericConverter for a life support mod?

Articles.Content:
I was thinking to make a mod that would interoperate with TAC life support. I wasn't sure if I should use TAC's resource converters (they have flight heritage, but might be about to be deprecated) or the new ModuleResourceConverter (which might be fine or might have issues that haven't become apparent yet if you try to use if to do conversion while warping etc).

Please let me know if you have any experiences re this.

If you want to "interoperate with TACLS" - the only way to do it properly - is using TACLS resource converters. 

1) They work correctly with insanely small rates (realistically slow conversion speeds).

2) They properly work in background.

Anyway To Tie The TacGenericConverter ConversionRate to the Ship max capacity? @theMoment I have several PART sections tied to numbered crew, 1 part for 1 crew, 1 PART for 2 crew 1 part for 3 crew etc, with each seperate vessel name in the PART[vessel1with1crew|vessel1with1crew] etc
